review_blob: On tap at the brewery from notes taken at the time. Beer is a very dark black color cocoa colored head, not much lace down the glass. Smells of roastiness and coffee. Tastes a bit sweet and the roasted malt is nice. Mouthfeel is maybe a bit thin for the style. Overall a nice beer

Clear copper pour with medium white head, nice lacing down the glass. Scent is both piney and grapefruity hops and bready malts.. Nice biscuty bready malt up front with great hop flavor in the back. Body is a little sticky with a bitter finish. One of the best IPAs Ive had.

From 12 oz bottle. Pours a dark red color one finger head with nice lacing down the glass. Smell is malty with some spices in there as well as woody scents. Taste is sweet caramelly and slight dark fruit flavors. also slight piney aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium to full. Very nice winter warmer

12 ounce bottle from notes taken when I had it. Color is somewhat cloudy dark copper with a nice white head. A sweet caramel biscuty malt aroma. The flavor is smooth and nice; sweet caramel and biscut malts, some light fruity flavor with slight hoppiness. Pretty drinkable session beer.

On tap at the brewery.  Pours cola colored with no head whatsoever.  Bread,  biscuty scent a touch of fruitiness, light earthy hops.  Flavors of sweet brown bread,  a little caramel, light earthy bitterness maybe some English style finishing hop in there?   Decent alt beer.

From the bottle, love the name of this one!! Pours an amber color with a nice fruty and malty scent to it.  Taste is slightly fruity up front with English bittering hop flavor in the aftertaste.  Nice ESB, Id get this one again for sure.

From 22 oz bottle. Notes taken at the time of consumption.  Cloudy orange color with tall foamy white head good lacing. Bit of a unique floral herbal aroma. Much like the aroma...herbal and floral taste.  Not really my favorite DIPA.   A little too rough around the edges.
beer_name: Laughing Dog Alpha Dog Imperial IPA

review_blob: On tap at the brewery from notes taken at the time.  Pours cloudy golden color white head and poor head retention.  Aroma is of peppers and that is about it.  Taste is slight wheat with a jalapeno aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is thin and watery.

On tap at the brewery.  From notes taken at the time.  Pours an amber color nice bubbly froth on top with good head retention.  Smell is slight caramel malt with citrusy/piney hops.  Taste is crisp citrusy flavor that you would expect in a good IPA. Good sharp mouthfeel.  Nice solid IPA.

On tap at brewery from notes at the time of consumtion.  Grapefruit, pine and floral aroma, very nice!!  Dark golden amber pour, nice brightness, creamy head. Flavors of caramel and pale malts, a little biscut... grapefruit, pine.  Very tasty IIPA.
Draft at brewery in Whitefish from notes taken at the time of consumption.  Fairly light and refreshing IPA. Notes: grapefruit, herbal lighter malt backbone.
beer_name: Great Northern Going To The Sun IPA

review_blob: Had this at the brewery.  Pours a slighty cloudy golden color.  Yeasty, wheat scent.  Taste is about the same.  Pretty boring basic American wheat beer.  If that is your thing you may like it.  I tend to like more Bavarian styles and I thought thats what I was getting.

Had on tap at the brewery from notes taken at the time.  Beer is an amber color, not much head or retention.  Smell is of butterscotch and some piney hops.  Taste is much the same but butterscotch drowns out most of the hop flavor.  This beer is obviously infected or something and virtually undrinkable.

Draft at the brewery.  Beer is a light amber color with not much head. Smell is sweet and slightly malty but aroma is not very pronounced at all. Taste is malty with a light grassy hop flavor.  Beer goes down easy, nice sessionable beer but could use a bit more richness in the flavor and aroma.
beer_name: Blackfoot River MacKenzie River Driftboat Amber

review_blob: Had this on tap at the brewery from notes taken at the time. Pours a nice clear dark golden color.  Good bubbly white head and nice lacing.  Smell is of roasted barley and breadiness and herbal hops.  Taste is great lots of biscut and bready flavors with a good crisp hop flavor.  Good mouthfeel.  One of my favorites from Red Lodge, very nice beer.

Had on tap at the brewery from notes taken at this time.  Beer pours a brown cola color, not too remarkable.   Not much head or lace at all.  Smell is sweet and malty.  Taste is much the same sweet with a slight nuttiness in there as well. Palate is very light and watery.  Not my favorite offering from these guys.

Had this on tap at Freakin Frog from notes taken at the time.  Aroma is brown sugar,  The flavor is sweet caramel, brown sugar with some spice in there as well.  Good crisp mouthfeel. The appearance is amber,clear, white head. Really nice beer.
beer_name: Widmer Brothers Reserve South by Northwest SXNW

review_blob: Pours a dark brown color, good frothy cream colored head with nice lacing down the glass.  Smell is of roasted dark barley and cocoa.  Taste is very much the same, chocolate flavors and coffee.  Mouthfeel had a good nitro creamy smooth feel.
tap at brewery review from notes taken at the time. Orange/golden pour with thin head. yeasty, slightly sour, apple, aroma. nice body, mild, fairly standard nothing really outstanding about this one.

Had this in a gowler, from notes taken at the time.  Pours into snifter a cola color with not a lot of head.  Smells of chocolate and coffee, nice roasty aroma.  Taste is sweet and chocolatey with a good roasted barley flavor and slight earthiness.  Overall this is a pretty good stout.

Had this a while back on tap at the brewpub, from notes taken at that time. Pours a nice orange color, good sized head with nice lacing.  Smell is piney and grapefruity.   Good amount of carbonation for the style.  Good IPA, I like this one a lot.

Had this from a bottle recently.  Pours a dark cola color, darker than any oktoberfest ive ever had before.  Not much head.  Smell is bready and caramelly.  Taste is much the same but kindof too much sweetness in there.  Id say this is more of a full bodied Oktoberfest, flat on the carbonation.  I expected a lot more out of this beer, wouldnt get it again probably.

Pours a dark golden color decent head and lacing.  Smell is sweet and malty.  Taste is of biscut malt and bread flavor with some earthy aftertaste.  Light to medium bodied palate with good carbonation.  Pretty decent Marzen beer.

Bottle. Pours bright orange with a lasting head and good head retention.  Smell is astringent, metallic, sour.  Slight pine in there. Taste is piney but astringent like crushed up asprins/metallic flavors. I didnt enjoy this one at all. Very odd.

From bottle. Pours dark brown, very hazy with little head. Malty, sweet nose. Taste is very sweet, with a mollasses taste and ETOH burn.   Full, thick , rich body. A little too sweet for me but a decent winter beer.

Had on tap at the brewery from notes I had taken at the time.  Light golden color.  Slight grainy scent and grassy hops.  Taste is nothing to write home about, slight grain flavor a bit hoppy at the finish.  Not an exciting beer.

On tap at the brewpub, from notes I took at the time.  Slightly cloudy yellow beer with not much head.  Nice banana, clove and yeasty estery scent.  Taste is much of the same with some sweet wheat and lots of banana and clove.  Im not much of a hef guy but this one I do like.

In bottle. Pours a golden color with a thin white head. Saison yeasty aroma, musty hay and honey.  Tastes of lemon rind, cherry, and a little metallic quality. Mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. One of the better cherry beers ive had

From a bottle, pours a pitch black color with small tan head.  Smells of coccoa and roasted barley.  Taste is sweet milk chocolate up front with roasty malts and slight mollasses.  Smooth medium bodied beer.  Pretty good, glad I picked this up.

Tap at the brewpub, from notes taken at the time.  Poured a dark black with a nice tan head.  Smell is of roasted barley and chocolate.  Taste is slightly sweet with good roasted malt flavor and dark chocolate.  Smooth palate.  Good tasting beer.

Tap at the brewpub from notes at the time.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden color, not much head.  Nose is of honey and slightly floral.  Tastes of wheat and honey sweetness.  Creamy smooth mouthfeel.  This is an ok Hef.

Had this out of a can, pours a nice dark ruby color with not a lot of head or lacing. Smells chocolatey and sweet also a bit smokey. Taste is sweet but not overly so, nice smokey flavor as well.  This is great beer
beer_name: Kettle House Cold Smoke Scotch Ale

review_blob: On tap at the brewery, from notes I had taken at the time.  Pours a clear golden color.  Nice biscuty caramel nose as well has herbal hops.  Taste is much the same.  Well balanced good tasting beer.
beer_name: Kettle House Fresh Bongwater Pale Ale

review_blob: 750 ml bottle poured into snifter.  Pours a dark brown color, small head.  Smells of dark fruit, figs and raisins.  Taste is of chocolate and dark fruit.  Medium to full bodied beer. This is good I would get this one again.
Dark ruby in color, no head.  Smell is weird, sour cherries and squash maybe?? Taste is of  sour cherries and oak also has that weird vegetable flavor.  This beer sucks!!

On tap at Chico.  Pours a nice clear golden/orange color with decent sized head and head retention.  Smell is lighly caramelly with good piney and citrusy aroma.  Tastes much the same, light caramel malt to balance out the citrusy hop flavor.  This is a nice IPA, like this quite a lot.
Pours an orange color with nice frothy head.  Aroma is fruity and citrusy.  Lightly malty up front with good grapefruity taste.  Carbonation is about right for an IPA.  Great tasting beer.
Pours a hazy orange color, decent head and lace.  Floral, earthy hop scent, slight bread as well.  Taste is more of an English style, earthy/piney hops.  Medium body slightly dry finish. Good beer.

Pours a clear orange color. Aroma is mostly spices, clove, nutmeg, cinnamon.  Taste is kindof like a gingerbread cookie or spice cake flavor.  Bready with lots of spices, maybe too much.  Beer is light in body and lightly carbonated.  Not my favorite winter beer, not complex and too spicy.

Out of a bottle, review is from notes previously taken.  Pours a rich brown color with a nice sized white head.  Smell is real smokey, nice campfire scent also roasted malt and coffee.  Taste is sweet and malty with a big smokey flavor....very nice. Nice rauchbier, would have this one again.

Pours a nice orange color with nice frothy white head, good lacing down the glass. Smell is nice juicy grapefruit and orange with a slight piney smell in there.  Taste is much the same very citrusy with a bit of pineapple.  Medium bodied beer with good amount of carbonation.  This double IPA is world class.

Pours from can a somewhat cloudy orange color.  Smell is fruity, citrusy and malty.  Taste is malt up front, good malt flavor actually bready and sweet. Nice citrusy grapefruity/tangerine hop flavor.  Mouthfeel is slick and sticky.  This is a good beer but a little to big for me personally, at 10% its just to much to have a couple, I like my IPAs on the more sessionable side but overall a good one.

Pours a nice golden color with bubbly smallish white head.  Smell is nice, corriander and citrus.  Taste is much of the same sweet up front followed by corriander and lots of orange.  Smooth easy drinking Belgian Wit.

Picked up a bottle of this in Oregon.  Cool pink bottle with cool art on the bottle.  Pours a reddish color, not much head.  Smell is smokey and malty.  Taste is smokey, too smokey to drink and not very complex just smoke and a bit of bacon.  This is a hard beer to choke down, I actually poured half of it out.
beer_name: Rogue Voodoo Doughnut Bacon Maple Ale

review_blob: Had this on tap in Missoula.  Pours a nice black color with a small head and not much lacing.  Smell is nutty and roasty.  Nice roasted flavor a bit of nuttiness and chocolate flavor.  Creamy palate.  Good tasting porter.

Had this on tap in Missoula.  Beer is a clear golden color, nice frothy white head with good lacing.  Smell is sweet and citrusy.  Taste is bready up front with nice Centennial hop flavor in there.  Nice crisp tasty IPA.

Pours a jet black color, nice sized tan head.  Smell is slight whiskey, dark fruit and chocolate.  Flavor is great.  Whiskey, tobacco, maple syrup and dark roasty malts.  Palate it thick and chewy.  This is one awesome beer.

Had this a while back at the brewery. Pours a jet black small tan head.  Smells sweet malty and of roasted barley.  Nice roasty taste as well as some chocolate.  Smooth creamy mouthfeel.  Nice tasting beer, much better than their lighter beers.
beer_name: Yellowstone Valley Black Widow Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: Had this on tap at the brewery.  Pours a nice golden/orange color with frothy white head and nice head retention.  Smell is very strong citrus scent.  Taste is much the same, with a light caramel sweetness to balance things out.  Palate is very nice and crisp.  Nice fresh hop flavor to this one, Id try this again for sure.

Had this on tap.  Poured a pink hued golden color.  Smells of cough syrup.  More of the same taste wise, cough syrup.  Reminds me of being sick as a child.  This beer is shitty.  Some things should just not be attempted.
